title: Skirt Panel, mid-19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: warp face plain weave and velvet
dimensions: Warp x Weft (warp hem at bottom, cut at top; weft selvedge on one side): 99 x 56 cm (39 x 22 1/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Black dress fabric that starts at the top with no pile and then adds horizontal stripes of velvet that gradually turn to grey/tan and the pile becomes longer at the bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Skirt Panel, mid-19th century.
mid-19th century. Medium: silk
Technique: warp face plain weave and velvet. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2004-6-1.
